exercises.title: HTML Text Article
exercises.content: In this exercise, you will create a short article about what you have learned about paragraph and header elements. You should have a title of "HTML Text Elements" and sections describing paragraphs and headers in HTML. You can use <hr> to create a horizontal line between sections.
exercises.solution:
HTML Text Elements

Paragraphs

In HTML, you can put text on your webpage by using the paragraph element (p). Within the opening and closing tags, you can put the content of the paragraph. However, note that empty lines within your text will be ignored, so you must either use
to insert a new line or create another paragraph element.

Headers

If you want to insert titles, headings, or larger, more important text, you can use the HTML headers. There are 6 elements (h1-h6) that should be used based on the size and importance of the header. The h1 element is the largest and most prominent, while h6 is the smallest. New lines are also ignored in header elements.

exercises.title: Employee directory
exercises.content: In this exercise, you will create a directory of employees at a company. You must include a title describing the directory (e.g., CodeWise Staff Directory). Then, you will create smaller headings with the names of each employee. Enter their role as a paragraph beneath their name. Separate each employee with a horizontal line (<hr>).
